mount.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to plan, organize, and begin an event or a course of action
mount.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The National Gallery mounted an exhibition of Danish painting.
Friends of the Earth are mounting a campaign to monitor the illegal logging of trees.
Guerrillas have mounted an attack on the capital.
mount.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to increase gradually in amount or degree
mount.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Tension here is mounting, as we await the final result.
Casualties on both sides of the battle have continued to mount.
mount.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to get on a horse or bicycle
mount.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He mounted his horse and rode on.
mount.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to go up a step or stairs
mount.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
A car suddenly mounted the pavement to avoid a vehicle coming in the opposite direction.
mount.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to fix a picture to a larger piece of stiff paper so that it looks more attractive
mount.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Entries to the photography competition should be mounted on white paper.
mount.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if a male animal mounts a female animal, he gets up onto her back to have sex
mount.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a horse that you ride on
mount.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: stiff paper that is put behind or around a picture or photograph so that it looks more attractive
mount.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: used as part of the name of a mountain
